root.name: Lux-Pain
root.description: Overview Lux-Pain is a visual novel-style adventure game for Nintendo DS developed by Killaware. It was published in Japan by Marvelous Entertainment on March 27th, 2008 with North American and European localizations being released a year later by Ignition Entertainment and Rising Star Games respectively.PlotThe player controls Atsuki, a teenager who obtained a strange power called Lux-Pain through an operation in his arm that lets him see and eliminate an infection that corrupts the human mind to commit horrible crimes. Atsuki sets off to rid the Kisaragi City from this strange infection named "Silent"Â that was the cause of the murder of his parents.Gameplay"Silence" removal Other than the standard adventure gameplay of going to locations and checking out object, the player will also have to use Atsuki's Lux-Pain power to spot and eliminate "Silence". This is done by scribbling the screen like a scratch ticket revealing what hides behind what the common eye sees.Localization One of the main criticisms leveled against Lux-Pain is its odd localization, or lack thereof. There's plenty of room for unintentional humor given the numerous misspellings, grammatical errors, and incredibly literal translations ("I ate his mind") found within.
